title: Missing Java Run-time in mlflow Docker image causes error in h2o example program
body:
### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: examples/h2o/random_forest.py
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: MacOS 10.14.2
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**:  MLflow Docker container
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: mlflow, version 0.8.2.dev0
- **Python version**: Python 2.7.15 :: Anaconda, Inc.
- **npm version (if running the dev UI): N/A
- **Exact command to reproduce**: 
```
docker run -it --rm mlflow /bin/bash
cd examples/h2o
python random_forest.py
```

### Describe the problem
h2o random forest example fails with the error message Java run-time not available.

### Source code / logs
```
Checking whether there is an H2O instance running at http://localhost:54321..... not found.
Attempting to start a local H2O server...
H2OStartupError: Cannot find Java. Please install the latest JRE from
http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html
Error in sys.excepthook:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/h2o/utils/debugging.py", line 95, in _except_hook
    _handle_soft_error(exc_type, exc_value, exc_tb)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/h2o/utils/debugging.py", line 225, in _handle_soft_error
    args_str = _get_args_str(func, highlight=highlight)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/h2o/utils/debugging.py", line 316, in _get_args_str
    s = str(inspect.signature(func))[1:-1]
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'signature'

Original exception was:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "random_forest.py", line 7, in <module>
    h2o.init()
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/h2o/h2o.py", line 277, in init
    bind_to_localhost=bind_to_localhost)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/h2o/backend/server.py", line 138, in start
    bind_to_localhost=bind_to_localhost, log_dir=log_dir, log_level=log_level)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/h2o/backend/server.py", line 271, in _launch_server
    java = self._find_java()
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/h2o/backend/server.py", line 410, in _find_java
    raise H2OStartupError("Cannot find Java. Please install the latest JRE from\n"
h2o.exceptions.H2OStartupError: Cannot find Java. Please install the latest JRE from
http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html
```

### Analysis:  
mlflow [Dockerfile](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/v0.8.1/Dockerfile) missing install of JRE.  Initial test of manually installing JRE with 
`apt-get install -y openjdk-8-jre-headless` 
resolved the error.  Pull #816
